title: Add Caption
name: Add_Caption
description: Adds a caption file for a remote asset (DFXP captions for the Smart Player). Note: 1) the caption endpoint is ONLY for working with DFXP captions used in the legacy Smart Player - WebVTT captions (text_tracks) for the new Brightcove Player are managed using the Update Video operation; 2) you can use /videos/ref:reference_id instead of /videos/video_id

Path Parameters.description: Video Cloud video ID. You can also use ref:reference_id

Request Body Fields.description: video reference id (must be unique within the account)
the url for a remote asset (not applicable to ingested assets)

Response Fields.description: whether processing is complete for the asset (will be true for remote assets if a remote_url is supplied)
the controller type for ingested renditions (not applicable to remote renditions or other types of assets)
the filename for an ingested asset in the Video Cloud system (not applicable to remote assets)
an internally used id (not applicable to remote assets)
whether ingested rendition is available by progressive download (not applicable to other asset types or remote renditions)
video reference id (must be unique within the account)
the url for a remote asset (not applicable to ingested assets)
name for remote streams (not applicable to asset types other than rendition)
the size of the asset in bytes (integer)
when the asset was added to the video in Video Cloud

Error 4xx.description: 401: Authentication failed; check to make sure your client credentials were correct for the access token
404: The api couldn't find the resource you requested
405: The HTTP method specified is not allowed for this endpoint
403: The resource you are requesting is temporarily unavailable
429: You are submitting too many simultaneous requests or too many requests per second
422: "remote_url: REQUIRED_FIELD" — this endpoint can only be used to add remote assets
409: The specified reference id is already in use

Error 5xx.description: 500: Issue in Brightcove system; try again later.
500: Server likely too busy; try again later.

title: Add DASH Manifest
name: Add_DASH_Manifest
description: Adds a location for a remote DASH manifest Notes: 1. you can have multiple dash manifests with profiles; you can have only one dash manifest without a profile, but one manifest without a profile can be combined with muliple manifests with profiles; 2. all manifests intended to be used with the CMS API should include a profile - only DASH manifests with profiles will be returned by the CMS API — only a single DASH manifest without a profile will be returned by the Media API 3. you can use /videos/ref:reference_id instead of /videos/video_id

the url for a remote asset (not applicable to ingested assets)

title: Add Rendition
name: Add_Rendition
description: Add a rendition to the given video. Ingested assets must be added via the Dynamic Ingest API. Note: you can use /videos/ref:reference_id instead of /videos/video_id

Path Parameters.description: Video Cloud video ID. You can also use ref:reference_id

average encoding_rate in kbps
frame height in pixels
frame width in pixels
asset name
video reference-id (must be unique within the account)
the url for a remote asset (not applicable to ingested assets)
the size of the asset in bytes (integer)
duration in milliseconds
the video codec — support for video formats - varies across browsers and devices; for the broadest support use h264 — remote assets will not work properly without this field
the video container such as MP4 or MT2S — remote assets will not work properly without this field

Response Fields.description: an internally used id (not applicable to remote assets)
whether processing is complete for the asset (will be true for remote assets if a remote_url is supplied)
the controller type for ingested renditions (not applicable to remote renditions or other types of assets)
the filename for an ingested asset in the Video Cloud system (not applicable to remote assets)

video reference id (must be unique within the account)
the url for a remote asset (not applicable to ingested assets)
name for remote streams (not applicable to asset types other than rendition)
the size of the asset in bytes (integer)
when the asset was added to the video in Video Cloud
